The '''Morgul-road''',<ref name=Shadow>{{RK|Shadow}}, pp. 916, 920</ref><ref name=Great>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 9, p. 1093</ref> also referred to as the '''Morgul-way''',<ref>{{RK|Shadow}}, p. 923</ref> the '''wraith-road''',<ref name=Stairs>{{TT|Stairs}}, p. 710</ref> or the '''Osgiliath Road''',<ref name=oldname>''[[The Chronology of The Lord of the Rings]]'', pp. 66, 67 (note 93), 115-6, 136, 137 (note 209), 144 (note 220)</ref> was a road in [[Gondor]] and [[Mordor]].

==Course==
The Morgul-road ran from [[Osgiliath]] slightly north of and roughly parallel to the river [[Morgulduin]]<ref>{{TT|Journey}}, p. 697</ref> to the [[Cross-roads]] where it crossed the [[Southward Road|road]] that ran from the [[Black Gate]] south to [[Harad]].<ref>{{TT|Journey}}, pp. 701-2</ref><ref name=Map>{{RK|Map}}</ref>

It continued eastward for a short distance until it approached a great shoulder of rock at the western end of the mountains on the north side of the [[Morgul Vale]] where it ran southwards along the shoulder until its end where the road turned eastwards again into the Morgul Vale and climbed steeply. After a short time it turned south-eastwards to the bottom of the valley where it crossed a bridge over the river [[Morgulduin]], and wound up to the gate of the city of [[Minas Morgul]], which was some way further east high up on a mountain shoulder on the southern side of the valley.<ref name=Ungol>{{TT|Stairs}}, pp. 703-4</ref>

The Morgul-road passed the gate of the city of [[Minas Morgul]] under the shadow of its walls and went up and up<ref name=Gate>{{TT|Gate}}, pp. 641-2</ref> east through the valley<ref name=Map/> to the great ravine at the head of the Morgul Vale<ref name=Stairs/> over a dark pass, the Morgul Pass.<ref name=Gate/> It then descended to the valley between the Ephel Dúath and the Morgai, passed over a bridge of stone,<ref name=Shadow/> and through a jagged rift in the Morgai out into [[Gorgoroth]] and on to [[Barad-dûr]].<ref>{{RK|Tower}}, p. 899</ref> Although it was safer than the more northerly and narrow [[Cirith Ungol|Pass of Cirith Ungol]] due to avoiding the threat posed by [[Shelob]], it was the slower way from Minas Morgul over the mountains.<ref name=Choices>{{TT|Choices}}, p. 736</ref>

==History==
The road was constructed in the high days of [[Gondor]] to connect [[Minas Tirith]] with [[Minas Morgul]], when they were still called the '''Minas Anor''' ("Tower of the Sun") and '''Minas Ithil''' ("Tower of the Moon").<ref>{{RK|Gate}}, p. 884</ref> It is possible that the part of the road from Minas Morgul over the Morgul Pass to the point below the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]] was constructed when Gondor built the latter tower after the [[War of the Last Alliance]] to watch [[Mordor]].<ref>{{RK|Tower}}, p. 900</ref>

On March 9 {{TA|3019}} at dusk<ref name=Great/> [[Frodo Baggins]], [[Samwise Gamgee]] and [[Gollum]] reached the Morgul-road at the [[Cross-roads]].<ref name=Great/> On the next day<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 10, p. 1093</ref> they continue on the road before it crosses the bridge over the Morgulduin and decide to leave the road to climb the [[Stairs of Cirith Ungol]] to avoid continuing on to Minas Morgul and risking detection.<ref name=Ungol/>

On March 18 and 19 {{TA|3019}} the [[Host of the West]] marched on the road from Minas Tirith to the Morgul Vale.<ref>{{App|Great}}, entries for the year 3019, March 18 and 19, p. 1094</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In notes on the chronology '''Osgiliath road''' is mentioned as another name for the Morgul-road.<ref>{{WR|3|III}}, "Morgul-road [= Osgiliath road]", p. 295</ref>

==Map==
[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] made a map that shows the course of the road from its approach to the Cross-roads to the gate of Minas Morgul.<ref>{{WR|2|VII}}, Minas Morghul and the Cross-roads (map), p. 181</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Morgul-road.jpg|thumb|300px|The Morgul-road in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2019: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Going east from the Crossroads, the Morgul-road turns somewhat to the south and passes through "Annon Morgul", a great guarded gate at the entrance to the [[Morgul Vale]]. It crosses Morgulduin at the "Gúliant" bridge, which is destroyed by [[Gandalf]] during the passage of the [[Army of the West]] to make any surpsise assault by the Enemy more difficult. After passing [[Minas Morgul]], the road begins to climb high into the valley and eventually crosses back onto the northern shore of Morgulduin by a smaller, unnamed bridge. At the [[Morgul Pass]] the road is guarded by a great gate "Fennas Gost". It the begins to descend down into the valley of "Lhingris" in the [[Plateau of Gorgoroth]] and crosses over to the [[Morgai]] by a great bridge "Iant Angos". The road eventually arrives into the plain of "Talath Urui" where it splits into two arms: going north and east of the [[Mount Doom]], both eventually lead to [[Barad-dûr]].
